title: 112_s790
content: The Act titled "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2011" mandates training programs for supervisors. The "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2011" amends Section 4121 of title 5, United States Code to define the term 'supervisor' and mandate training programs for supervisors. The "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2011" mandates a program for supervisors to provide training on various actions and strategies, including developing goals, mentoring employees, fostering a fair work environment, managing unacceptable performance, and addressing reports of harassment or hostile work environments. The "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2011" requires supervisors to undergo training on prohibited personnel practices, employee rights, and mentoring new supervisors. The "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2011" mandates training for new supervisors on various skills like communication, critical thinking, teamwork, and leadership. Training programs should be interactive and instructor-based, to be completed within one year of appointment. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management may establish procedures for extending the 1-year training period for supervisors. Supervisors must undergo training every 3 years, with credit given for previous training. Agencies must evaluate the effectiveness of training programs. Regulations will be prescribed to ensure agency compliance. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management may establish procedures for extending the 1-year training period for supervisors. Regulations will be prescribed to ensure agency compliance with monitoring and assessing supervisor training programs. The Director shall submit an annual report to appropriate congressional committees on training requirements. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management will report to congressional committees on the number of extensions and individuals completing training requirements. Regulations will be prescribed within a year of the Act's enactment. The Act will take effect 1 year after enactment and will apply to individuals appointed or employed as supervisors. Those employed as supervisors on the effective date must complete required programs. The Act requires individuals appointed or employed as supervisors to complete programs under section 4121(b)(2) of title 5, United States Code within 3 years of the effective date, and every 3 years thereafter in accordance with section 4121(d)(2) and (3) of that title. The Act mandates that supervisors must complete management competency programs within specified timeframes. The Act requires supervisors to complete management competency programs within specified timeframes. Chapter 43 of title 5, United States Code, is amended to include new provisions on management competencies for supervisors defined under specific criteria. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management will issue guidance to agencies on the competencies supervisors must meet to effectively manage employee performance. Each agency will develop additional competencies based on the guidance provided. Each agency must assess supervisors' performance and capacity annually, submitting a report to the Office of Personnel Management. Amendments to chapter 43 of title 5, United States Code include new provisions on management competencies for supervisors.
